In the 1960s, popular music groups such as The Beach Boys promoted the image of Californians as laid-back, tanned beach-goers.
data.partBlankContent: California has long been a subject of interest in the public mind and has often been promoted by its boosters as a kind of paradise. In t__ early 20th cen____, fueled b_ the eff____ of st___ and lo___ boosters, ma__ Americans s__ the Golden State a_ an id___ resort desti______, sunny a__ dry a__ year ro___ with ea__ access t_ the oc___ and moun_____. In the 1960s, popular music groups such as The Beach Boys promoted the image of Californians as laid-back, tanned beach-goers.
data.answer: 长期以来，加州一直是公众感兴趣的一个主题，它的支持者经常把它宣传为一个天堂。在20世纪初，在各州和当地支持者的推动下，许多美国人把这个“金州”视为理想的度假胜地，一年四季阳光明媚，气候干燥，而且到海边和山上也很方便。20世纪60年代，“海滩男孩”(the Beach Boys)等流行音乐组合将加州人塑造成悠闲、晒得黝黑的海滩游客形象。
